Is it the old Frasier? No, but no one should expect it to be. It's the next chapter of his life and I'm here for it! I loved the first couple episodes. Although some of the acting from the newbies was a little cheesy, I liked the humor and seeing more of the lovable pompous lead.
It's amazing that after 20 years, Kelsey Grammer picks up exactly where he left off. Great cast. Great show.
Dumb dumb dumb and boring boring boring.  I liked the original Fraser.  This one is a money grab.
Exceptional, finally a 2023 tv show with good acting, smart writing and absolutely no politically correct cliche characters !!!

Incredibly well done. Frasier starts up again without missing a beat! The new members to the cast are deliciously fun and the chemistry is already palpable!! Loads of talent here and the story is beautiful unfolding already!

Its not easy to bring a beloved franchise with an almost completely new cast, but watching the first two episodes shows it hold great potential, even if it starts off a little slow. 
In the first two episodes there are a few twists and the chemistry between most of the characters is sparkling - even if the dialogue is not quite there yet.
Looking forward to seeing this grow. 
Well worth a watch.
Feel in love with this show all over again. Excited to see where this show takes off.

Dont listen to the critics. The show is fresh, creative, yet nostalgic. The new characters work into their roles perfectly. The plot is on point . I cant wait to see where they go going forward.

Take into effect most of the "expert opinions" are sour because Kelsey Grammer's politics and religious beliefs 

They are giving him the Chris Pratt treatment.
Absolutely amazing! It's just great to have Frasier back! The show has reinvented itself!
I loved it! I didn't have high expectations because of the character changes.  I loved the original Frasier series and this new series had me laughing out loud plenty of times. I hope it keeps going!

I'm so happy with the first two episodes. They were of high quality and had a quick pace, and they made me laugh. Frasier is back in the building!

The character of Freddie needs more development, or maybe the actor's not quite right for the role. I have high praise for every other character. The guys in the fire department are funny with their mild peculiarities. 

This is a series that will be a delight to follow.

I LOVED the new Frasier.  Not sure what all the critics were watching.  Was it the same as the old Frasier? No!  Were there some things that were the same? Yes! It was the perfect mix of new and old!  Hope so see many more episodes!

I really don't get what the professional critics are missing. This show has plenty of potential and by the end of the second episode has already established a unique identity. This is the triumphant return of comfort television, something we really need now.
Screw the critics and their short-sighted views, the new Frasier is a welcome return for one of TV's most iconic characters - and Kelsey Grammar, et al., do not disappoint.

This was a welcome third act. With TV shows today so trashy they are not worth watching. It was refreshing to watch something with a little class. No one gave the original much of a shot and then look what happened. I think with time the cast will gel more and  grow their chemistry.

It has enough of the old feel coupled with new ideas to make for a fresh viewing. I laughed a fair bit and enjoyed the homage to the character of Martin Crane. I was sad that there were only two episodes at the premiere, but I'm just eager to see more. Glad it got another shot.

An excellent successor to the classic show. I was very worried seeing critic reviews but as per usual the critics reviews and opinions are clearly worthless.
I found the jokes charming and the pacing decent, and I am looking forward to watching more.
If you enjoyed the original Frasier series then you will enjoy the reboot. The new characters are an amalgamation of the old characters. There's even a hint of Cheers thrown in!

From reading some of the critics, Many of them have been out of touch for awhile. 
While only 2 episodes have dropped at the time of writing, The dynamics between father and son start off a lil awkward (Just like in the original). But not as cringey as I found the nephew to be. Yet, It does have that Frashier charm. If written properly moving forward, This show has the potential of being really good. Maybe not like the original bc let's face it, You can do more in a 22-24 episode season vs a 10 episode season. Ijs

I loved it, the first two episodes were heart warming and funny. I really like the new cast and Kelsey Grammer is just as wonderful as ever. The show feels like inviting an old friend for a long overdue catch up. I'm really looking forward to seeing where they go with the show.

I went into this show with low expectations, give. The quality of recent revivals of classic shows. The original Frasier is my favorite sitcom of all time, so I didn't want to see that memory tarnished. That being said I was delighted to be wrong. Kelsey Grammer is amazing as ever as Frasier. The supporting cast is strong with the possible exception of Frasier's nephew, who hopefully will have his character developed more in future episodes. The chemistry between Frasier and Freddy is instant and not forced. I certainly did not expect to cry during the first episode and yeah I found myself blubbering during their heart to heart towards the end of the episode. I can't wait for the rest of the season!!
I enjoyed it completely. It was visiting an old friend 😀

Unwatchable. Dry, stale, unfunny, and frankly mostly sad.
It was depressing to see a very elderly Grammer struggling to find his mojo.

I love this show.  It doesn't feel like a reboot, it is just like the next season of the original.  The best thing about it though is this show delivers laughs and heart and I never have to wonder about what will be onscreen when my kids walk into the room.  Here's hoping Martin left a certain "eclectic" recliner to his grandson.

If your not going to do it justice, then don't do it at all.  Its no wonder 'Niles & Daphne's' didn't return, this show is just embarrassing & pointless.  From episode 1 of the original Fraiser  (I've been watching sine I was 16, in 1993 but re-watched to make sure) the show has Energy & Comedy in excess, this remake lacks EVERYTHING that would make a good show, and without swift intervention will end production swiftly and be forgotten even sooner.

Each & every character from Original Fraiser could quite easily have commanded their own show, they were strong & believable, even the Guest stars, they were perfectly cast & the actors delivered quality lines flawlessly, it made the show a hit that has lasted time.  The supporting characters of new Fraiser lack screen presence, energy & quite frankly talent, and although Fraiser revives his mannerisms well, again his character's energy has completely diapered too, leaving poorly written, unfunny lines being delivered flat on the floor, along with the show it's self. No one will ever look back on the series, and that sadden's me. 

IMO This show should have moved forward, not looked backwards, the whole premise was flawed from the beginning by creating a direction that constricted the writing in a certain direction, trying to recreate characters that emulated past. The idea of Fraiser become a successful TV personality was perfect, why did they not run with that, hosting his own talk show with a whole new direction to take, and new comedy to explore. oh well... at least I'm not being forced to watch it, I will simply pretend new Fraiser does not exist

So good to see Kelsey back as Frasier, as a long term fan of his character going back to his 1st appearance in Cheers in 1984 I couldn't wait to see where he was in his life. It's a new era, new characters but the same strong writing. Loved it, really looking forward to more.

Don't listen to the critics, if you're a fan of the original series, you'll enjoy the reboot. I didn't have high expectations for this and my wife and I really enjoyed the first 2 episodes. Even with a new cast the show has the same feel as the original series.
Check it out!!
Really enjoyed the first episode. I wasn't sure beforehand after seeing the trailers but exceeded my expectations

I loved the original and I was open to this new chapter. The first two episodes were very good. I decided to go into this with no expectations and It really surprised me. Same Frasier, different cast but very like-able. I enjoyed it and was surprised by how much I liked it.
Light and fun, lots of good comedy. Not stale, just not new.
Loving it so far! It really does capture the feel of the original. Very funny and entertaining! Here's another example of how critics don't know anything.
Loved it! Stays true to the humor of the original series. Frasier is still the lovable snob that is oblivious to anything sports or pop culture. His heart of gold to help and love is still the same.

I've only watched the first episode so far but I'm a super fan of Frasier so I'm totally biased. There were some corky parts, but some really good funny parts too. I loved the way the writers pretty much addressed all of our questions right away! Nothing will ever be as good as the original but so far I'm liking this spin off 👍🏾

7.9/10 Stars 

On Frasier's 3rd go around the show still holds the wit, ironic situations, and great character development. Some dry moments but overall good.
After watching the reboot, I now understand why the cast from the old series passed on this reboot. No Niles, Roz, Daphne or Eddie = watch something else.

The thing is, John Mahoney is irreplaceable. David Hyde Pierce is irreplaceable. It would be foolish to even try! But this reboot DOES try, and it just doesn't work. Kelsey Grammer is as good as ever, and he's doing his damnedest to make the show worth watching, but the problem is he's surrounded by an ensemble of cardboard cutouts. That's not to say that they're bad actors (although they're not great), but they're stuck playing characters that are just cheap knock-offs of the original series. Freddie's development from precocious goth teenager into "Martin 2.0" feels particularly forced and contrived. IF the series gets renewed (and I wouldn't be surprised if it didn't), I hope they make some major changes to right the ship, although I'm not sure any amount of "retooling" is enough to save a series with bones as bad as these: after all, how do you tell a new story when you've set yourself up to just tell the old one again? It's not horrible, there are some moments that are genuinely quite funny, but that's not enough to save this reboot from feeling derivative and uninspired.

First show was a classic, you can see right away the reboot has no shot but nice to meet up with an old familiar face and who doesn't love scrambled eggs 🙂

The old English guy does NOT grow on you I have to ffw Everytime he's on screen 😢.

Fake Freddie is no prize either 😢.

Frazier was and still is one of my top three favorite TV shows ever. I literally put it on every night and that's how I go to sleep. Yes I have seen the entire series at least seven times, or at least the first 15 minutes until I fall asleep. Haha.
So you can imagine how excited I was for the reboot. Before the first commercial hit on Paramount Plus, I knew it was doomed. I struggled to get through the first episode and was walking away when the only good part of the show was the farewell to John Mahoney AKA Martin Crane. I'm not even going to bother with the second episode.
Clearly Niles and Daphne saw the pending doom and that's probably why they wanted nothing to do with it. So sad because I was so excited.  Definitely the top three stupidest shows I've ever seen. 😔

I was so pleasantly surprised by the first two episodes of the new series of Frasier. Kelsey Grammer flawlessly stepped back into character and the surprising cast around him is amazing as well. I was so skeptical about how Freddie possibly grew into this macho like fire fighter character, but after realizing how much he idolized his grandfather and the close bond the characters shared in the original series, it completely made sense. Nicholas Lyndhurst is going to become the best part of this show. Only time will tell when.

I feel like if you're really a Frasier fan, you'll like it. It's not the original Frasier and it never will be, but I still thought it was pretty great. I think Alan, his colleague is pretty funny. Freddy is great too. There are some moments that are kinda cheesey but overall, it was funny. I think everyone needs to calm down.

I loved how Kelsey Grammer smoothly transitioned into a little older, but still the same, Frasier! I was worried the reboot would be dull without other supporting characters or lack the usual Frasier charm. But no, the whole cast did amazing! I felt like no time had passed, and I just continued watching the original series. I hope we will see Roz, Niles, Daphne, Lilith, and Bulldog, of course. But so far, the show is wonderful! And what a heartwarming tribute to John Mahoney!

It was an excellent, two series introduction. Kelsey Grammer stepped directly into this new version of Frasier. I have high hopes for all of the new characters. I especially liked the facility, college characters and his son.

First off let me start by saying that I am a die hard Frasier fan. I rewatch the original 11 seasons every single day, and I'm not exaggerating. I watch them during my free time, and to help put me to sleep because Frasier relaxes me. I was so excited, and also scared of this new reboot, but overall thankful that we all finally got new episodes! They did not disappoint!! Is it exactly the same as the original? Of course not. The entire cast is different aside from frasier, and he's now living in Boston. Do not go into this thinking you are getting the exact same show. It is however, still hilarious, witty, and pays homage to the original and its characters. I laughed, I cried (well blubbered) and I felt at home again. I am so unbelievably happy with this re boot and it better stay on the air. If you love frasier just as much as I do then you will be ecstatic about this new season.

The reboot of Frasier is a is a blend of old charm and new humor. Kelsey Grammer shines as ever, effortlessly reprising his iconic role, showcasing impeccable comedic timing that feels both refreshing and nostalgically comforting. The show navigates new comedic terrains while paying a heartfelt tribute to the original narrative. It's an enjoyable ride through sophisticated humor and tender moments, making the Frasier reboot a delightful watch in these turbulent times. Through witty dialogues and fresh scenarios, this reboot serves as a perfect homage to a beloved classic, proving that good comedy is indeed timeless.
I loved it. The new characters fit nicely and it has the same charm as the original. AND....It's funny!!!
I really enjoyed the first two shows and am excited to watch the entire season.  I loved the old Frasier and it's fun to see what is happening now in his life!

If you can't do better or even at the same level as the first why do it? This show is boring and depressing. The original had a warmth from the 90s and a perfect cast. Why do we need to remake everything. Other than Frasier himself this is not the same show. In the original you could enjoy the antics of Frasier with his father, brother, and Daphne. I understand that this show is trying to be fresh, but it constantly reminds you of its predecessor. The laugh track is also so insufferable. The new characters are so flat, They are just boring. There is so much more things I could say about this show including the location. Seattle was where Frasier belonged.

What a delight! It's not "perfect" television, but it sure feels like a natural extension of the original series, even with limited returning characters. Alan Cornwall comes off almost as a character that could have been on the original sitcom and you just somehow forgot about him. It is very satisfying to see Frasier back!

I agree with another reviewer, "Ignore the cranky professionals".  I found the writing, direction, comedic timing, editing and, in most cases, the acting to be excellent.  I pity the actor positioned to portray Niles' son.  Few could compare favorably with David Hyde Pierce.  Should there be more seasons (never assume), I hope Pierce re-considers.

I worry about older comedic actors returning to find they had lost their comedic timing, but Kelsey Grammer still very much has his.  I think it's a great show.  The network will probably cancel it ;-)

Long time Frasier fan from the very beginning. I went into this reboot with A LOT of scrutiny. As one of Frasier's biggest fans (obviously self-proclaimed) I have big expectations and I have no desire to support a reboot of my favorite show ever unless it's actually well done and true to form. I was not disappointed! It started off slow and took some time to hook me but it felt just as fun, silly, and dry in a good way as the original with enough variation to feel new. No it's not exactly the same but the point of a reboot is to refresh and revitalize an old standard and I think they've done that here. I can't wait for more episodes and I hope they continue to deliver what the fans want.

I've been a fan of Frasier most of my life since it first premiered. I was worried with most of the cast not returning that it may not to live up to the original. While I reminded myself that the original frasier didn't have any of the previous cast members of cheers on as the main cast either (outside of Frasier) I was both excited and apprehensive about this remake. Long story short, the 2 episodes thus far have bested my expectations and have been a joy to watch. If you're looking for the Frasier nostalgia, this hits home.
the supporting cast is the problem with this reboot.
They lost me as soon as I leard the laugh track.

It almost feels like Frasier is still listening and never left.  This was a charming start to what I bet will be a great season.  It had the smart quick whit of old and lots of feels.  If you don't shed a tear while watching the first episode then you're a heartless troll. I can't wait to see more.

I thought the reboot was funny, and had a few good calls backs.  Was it great, no but I seem to remember the original needed a few episodes to find it's footing so I'm in for the rest of the season.  With all the crap on TV these days, if it just stays the same as the first episode it will be good enough for me.
Glad to see Frazier back and it's good to see new faces! I also enjoy the callbacks to Cheers and the original show. Can't wait to see more episodes.

Hilarious!!!! Frasier himself is just as funny as ever. The original series is one of the 10 best sitcom of all time, hands down, period! It's almost impossible to beat. 
This new series, if it was called anything else (alway being compared to the original series) would be an instant hit!!! 
However, this new cast is hilarious and Frasier hasn't lost a step. I hope we have a nice long run ahead of us!
Don't listen to the critics. If you are a fan of the original, I think you will enjoy this quite a bit.

Ignore the cranky professional critics. It's charming, funny, well-written and well-cast. I think had those critics who are loftily panning it seen this version before they saw the old "Frasier," they would have been wetting their pants to praise it.

What can  I say?  Sorry, nothing
We didn't laugh once
I am very optimistic about seeing Frasier in his golden years. The cast is great- Kelsey is amazing as usual. And I especially like Olivia and David.
While it can never rise to the perfection that is the original, you can't help but adore Grammar's performance as Fraiser - it feels fresh and new but with all the nostalgia. Sitcoms are back!

I don't agree with the critics - I love this character and am glad to have him back. I think as the show progresses the characters will grow in their roles and the show will find its own place - instead of being compared to the original.

I had the privilege of seeing all 10 episodes as member of the studio audience and I must say that Kelsey and many of the people who were involved in the original run (like casting director Jeff Greenberg) did a marvelous job making this new revival seem like we discover Frasier Crane 20 years later. The cast, writing and quality honor the reputation of television's most honored comedy. Bravo!

9/10 Based on first two episodes. Loved it!! Frasier is back and it brought all the feels.  I was prepared for the worst based on the trailer and taken by surprise how good it was. Just a few minutes in and I was already slapping my knees.  Excited for more!

This is brilliant! Despite not having original cast, this has the feels to it! It's funny! It's emotional. It does a fantastic send off to Martin! I think it's amazing and Nicholas Lyndhurst has smashed it once again!

Huge life-long Frasier fan here...The first 3 episodes of the new reboot felt a little shaky, even cringey at times. The character development had to get the basics out of the way at first I suppose. But with each episode it has gotten better and better.  Episode 4 was just hilarious with David (Niles & Daphne's son) being mistaken for an orphan at the fire dept   Episode 5 feels just like "old" Frasier in the best possible ways and we belly laughed throughout the episode. It's pretty remarkable that he (Kelsey) can still channel the character and still be as funny as he ever was. Some ask if this needed to be made... And I think you can say that about hundreds of shows these days, but this one is a gem and deserved a shot at a revival.  So happy they did.  I think they are hitting the stride.  Lovin' it!

I am so glad the show is back! It's a perfect combination of smart comedy that's witty and fun with heart and the  importance of barging into each other's lives every once in a while, because we actually need that. 
We needed this.

I really enjoyed this. Maybe I'm old school, but it was just nice to watch, like an old episode of Cheers. The writing was solid, performances great, chemistry great. Just well done. My only complaint is that the season is only 10 episodes. 26 would be much nicer.
Much better than what was in the teaser/trailer. It's funny and full of heart. Love Frasier!
First episode was a little rough but the second was much better. Great to have you back Dr. Crane!
Kelsey Grammer effortlessly returns life to a beloved character. For fans of the original show it is a welcome return of a beloved friend in new surroundings.
